metadata.title: Deputy Speaker pays tribute to Shaheed BB on her 72nd birth anniversary

content.article_body: ISLAMABAD, Jun 21 (APP): Deputy Speaker National Assembly Syed Ghulam Mustafa Shah has paid glowing tribute to Shaheed Mohtarma Benazir Bhutto, the first democratically elected female Prime Minister of Pakistan and in the Muslim world, on her 72nd birth anniversary. In his message on Saturday, the Deputy Speaker hailed Shaheed Benazir Bhutto as a champion of democracy, human rights and public welfare, whose unwavering struggle set an unparalleled example for future generations. He said that Shaheed Mohtarma Benazir Bhutto was a torchbearer of democracy who fiercely defended democratic values during every era of dictatorship. Mustafa Shah emphasized that her legacy continues to inspire not only Pakistan but also women across the Islamic world, calling her a shining example of courage. He said that her sacrifices for democracy remain an unforgettable chapter in Pakistan's history. "Her vision and ideas still serve as a guiding light for the nation's democratic leadership," he added. Deputy Speaker said that Shaheed Benazir Bhutto was a staunch advocate for equal opportunities, emphasizing the political inclusion of youth, women, and minorities as essential for national progress. While praising her role in rekindling political consciousness, he said, "She revived the People's Party in line with Quaid-e-Awam's mission and instilled new hope among youth. Deputy Speaker acknowledged the Pakistan Peoples Party's continued commitment to democratic values under the leadership of Asif Ali Zardari and Bilawal Bhutto Zardari. "The party has played a pivotal role in strengthening parliamentary traditions and democratic continuity," he added. He also commended Chairman Bilawal Bhutto Zardari for his prudent and effective diplomacy in presenting Pakistan's stance on global platforms, especially concerning Pak-India conflicts.
